# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is the Julia code for your task:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    lines = AbstractString[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= " " * word
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)  # add the last line
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
s = "This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped within a certain text width."
print(wrap_string(s))
```
